data: NICU Management of Post-Hemorrhagic Hydrocephalus (PHH) - No Ventricular Access Device In Situ
This PowerPlan is applicable for infants in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) only

Clinical Indications:  - Infants with IVH Grade III or IV detected by ultrasound, defined according to CNN's preterm brain injury definition:  - Grade III: intraventricular hemorrhage with blood occupying >50% of ventricular volume AND associated with ventricular dilatation on ultrasound (AHW > 6 mm and/or Levene Index > 97th percentile)  - Grade IV: Periventricular hemorrhagic infarction or intraparenchymal hemorrhage  - Infants with any grade of IVH associated with ventriculomegaly on ultrasound

Intervention Recommendations:  
- Crossing the Levene 97th percentile for postmenstrual age: consult neurosurgery when Levene Index > 97th percentile so that neurosurgery can follow along in the event that the Levene Index surpasses 97th percentile + 4mm. Repeat head ultrasound at least 2 times per week  - If any of the following, then perform head ultrasound: head circumference crosses percentiles (i.e. growth > 1.5 cm/week), bulging fontanelle, split sutures, apnea/bradycardia events above baseline requiring intervention within 24 hours  
- If Levene 97th percentile + 4mm line is crossed, Neurosurgery will organize for open access OR time for reservoir insertion within 48-72h. In the meantime, serial LPs should be considered: once per day, 10 ml/kg to be removed each time
Aim for removing 10 mL/kg of CSF fluid
